importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date when Colombia recalled its ambassador to the United States, marking a significant escalation in diplomatic tensions between the two countries.
The date when the US recalled its ambassador to Colombia, preceding Colombia's subsequent recall of its ambassador, indicating a recurring pattern of diplomatic friction.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period immediately following the US attack on a drug-smuggling vessel, during which diplomatic relations between Colombia and the US deteriorated sharply, culminating in the recall of ambassadors.

keyTakeAways: Colombia has recalled its ambassador to the United States, Daniel García-Peña, for consultations, citing US attacks on alleged drug-smuggling vessels and threats of economic sanctions.
This is the second time in 2025 that Colombia has recalled its ambassador to Washington, following a prior incident in July when the US recalled its ambassador to Bogotá.

US President Donald Trump accused President Gustavo Petro of being an 'illegal drug leader' and threatened to end large-scale payments and subsidies to Colombia, accusing it of failing to combat drug trafficking.

The US conducted missile attacks on seven vessels in the Caribbean, claiming they were involved in drug trafficking, resulting in at least 30 deaths; Colombia alleged that some of those on board were Colombian citizens, accusing the US of 'murder'.
A Colombian citizen aboard the most recent vessel attacked was returned safely to Colombia, adding to the controversy over the US military actions.
The Colombian government, through Foreign Minister Rosa Yolanda Villavicencio Mapy, stated that decisions regarding further diplomatic actions will be announced in due course.
The US announced plans to raise tariffs on Colombian goods, signaling potential economic retaliation against Colombia.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Colombia has recalled its ambassador to the United States, Daniel García-Peña, for consultations, in response to US military attacks on vessels allegedly involved in drug trafficking and accusations that the US is targeting Colombian citizens. This marks the second such diplomatic action in 2025, following a prior US recall of its ambassador. President Gustavo Petro has accused the US of supporting a political plot against him and of committing 'murder' through the attacks, while US President Donald Trump has called Petro an 'illegal drug leader' and threatened to cut subsidies and raise tariffs on Colombian goods, intensifying tensions between the two nations. The situation reflects a broader conflict over drug policy, national sovereignty, and the legitimacy of military intervention in the Caribbean.
title: Colombian ambassador to US recalled to Bogotá for consultations, embassy says
